content:
That's a great idea! Booking your accommodations and tours in advance will ensure that you get the best options and avoid any last-minute hassles. It's always a good feeling to have your plans in place, especially when traveling to popular destinations like the Grand Canyon and Monument Valley.

During your trip to Chicago, take some time to research and book your accommodations, tours, and activities. You can also use that time to:

1. Check the weather forecast for your trip and pack accordingly.
2. Research any specific rules or regulations for the national parks and monuments you'll be visiting.
3. Plan your itinerary in more detail, including your daily schedule and any specific activities you want to do.
4. Download any necessary maps or guides for your trip.
5. Notify your bank and credit card companies of your travel plans, so they don't flag your transactions as suspicious.

By the time you return from Chicago, you'll have a solid plan in place, and you can focus on getting excited for your adventure!

If you have any more questions or need further recommendations, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I'll let you get back to your planning. Safe travels to Chicago, and I look forward to hearing about your trip!
